member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.AtlasEffect
member.summary: Outputs a specified region from an atlas bitmap.

remarks.p: The atlas effect is useful if you want to load a large image made up of many smaller images, such as various frames of a sprite. The effect crops the input to the given SourceRectangle, and then translates the origin of the result to (0,0).
This Windows Runtime type corresponds to the D2D Atlas effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.AtlasEffect.PaddingRectangle
member.summary: The padding rectangle specifies how much padding was included when creating the atlas bitmap. This should only be larger than SourceRectangle if the pixels between the two rectangles are transparent black. This may result in Direct2D executing the graph more efficiently.

member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the effect.

remarks.p: Generic way to query the type of an effect. EffectId is equal to the CLSID_D2D1Atlas GUID specified in the SDK header d2d1effects.h.
